title: Strengthening System Design Practical Competencies: Iterative Learning Control for Multi-Agent System Formation Control

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational control theory, linear system modeling, and basic graph theory concepts
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of formation control in multi-agent systems and derive relative positioning control methods based on directed graphs.
Learners can perform simulations applying Iterative Learning Control (ILC) algorithms to reduce target formation error to within 5% in finite time.
Learners can analyze convergence conditions based on Linear Matrix Inequalities (LMIs) and evaluate robustness for systems with stochastic disturbances.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
